text: Daudpur is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Daudpur. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Daudpur has a total number of 210 houses and population of 1,032 of which include 563 males and 469 females. Literacy rate of Daudpur is 79.11%, higher than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 113 which is 10.95% of total population of Daudpur, and child sex ratio is approximately 738, lower than state average of 846. == Caste == The village has schedule caste (SC) constitutes 29.46% of total population of the village and it doesn't have any Schedule Tribe (ST) population. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" ! title: Daudpur, Kapurthala
